title: What’s In and What’s Out of Democrats’ $2 Trillion Budget Reconciliation Plan
sub_head: Intraparty talks aim to finalize antipoverty, healthcare and climate package
body:
Democrats are working to complete a framework on a roughly $2 trillion education, healthcare and climate plan they hope to approve this fall without Republican support. Here are details on where the proposal stands.
The legislation, as initially conceived, was expected to include paid family and medical leave, subsidized child care, an extension of an expanded child tax credit, universal prekindergarten for 3- and 4-year-olds and two years of tuition-free community college.
